paper_abstract: We consider a system of N points x (1) < ... < x (N) on a segment of the real line. An ideal system (crystal) is a system where all distances between neighbors are the same. Deviation from idealness is characterized by a system of finite differences a double dagger (i) (1) = x (x+1) - x (i) , a double dagger (i) (k+1) = a double dagger (i+1) (k) - a double dagger (i) (k) , for all possible i and k. We find asymptotic estimates as N -> a, k -> a, for a system of points minimizing the potential energy of a Coulomb system in an external field.
paper_title: Fine structure of a one-dimensional discrete point system
